body.name: Gillette SkinGuard Razors, 1 Gillette Razor, 4 Razor Blade Refills, Designed for Men with Skin Irritation, Razor Bumps, and Sensitive Skin
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 23 mins
features: MINIMIZES BLADE CONTACT WITH SENSITIVE SKIN, so you will not get as close of a shave as you would expect from our razors with 5 blades
2 BLADES plus SKINGUARD designed for men with skin irritation, razor bumps, and razor burn
The SKINGUARD PROTECTS SKIN FROM THE BLADES with it's position between the blades to smooth skin
LUBRICATION BEFORE AND AFTER THE BLADES for glide and comfort
PRECISION TRIMMER on the back is perfect for hard-to-reach places and styling facial hair
body.description: The Gillette SkinGuard razor blade refills are clinically proven for sensitive skin with the SkinGuard feature that smooths your skin and protects it from the blades. It is designed to stop irritation with lubrication before and after the blade, working to minimize tug and pull and cut hair at the skin level. The soft microfins gently smooth and stretch skin while the microcomb guides hair to the blade. These blade refills feature our thinnest blades and a precision trimmer which is perfect for hard-to-reach places and styling facial hair. Your shave will have the right blend of closeness to avoid potential irritations you may have experienced from other razors. This may be a bit different from the Gillette shave you've experienced in the past but you will still get a great shave that helps stop irritation and razor bumps. SkinGuard blade refills fit all SkinGuard razor handles.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Bought this because I stole my dad’s razor due to my Gillette handle snapping. This is actually a pretty good razor. The green strip of moisture is actually really good even if I use regular body wash to shave with instead of shave cream. I’ve noticed less nix but if you press hard be careful it’s a good blade!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect, if you understand pros/cons
reviews.reviewText: A true where-has-this-been-all-my-life product. I struggled with razor burn using a 4-blade Harrys razor, as well as a Mach3, and was looking for something with less blades to sacrifice closeness for a more comfortable shave. At first I tried a SupplyCo single blade razor (garbage product), before giving this a try.This does not shave as close as a 4-5 blade razor, but it is fine so long as you're not attempting to hack your way through multi-day stubble. I experienced zero razor burn, so I'm thrilled.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fairly Good Option for Those Who Don't Wet Shave Often
reviews.reviewText: This is a good razor for those who find it hard to NOT cut yourself whilst shaving.I will say, this is not a body hair shaver, your best bet for body hair is cutting it (when it's long) with the trimming blade. Don't go too wild, it's just that: trimming.Now, as for how it shaves, it is actually fairly decent.Glide: As far as how it glides across the shaving area, it depends on a couple of things. How much shaving cream is there on the area? When did you last shave? Which areas is it in, any problematic areas for you to shave? I find it hard to wet shave a lot of my face without some discomfort, but in areas where it's not as problematic, it glides fairly well.Shave Closeness: Since it has two blades, it, of course, is not as deep as 5, 4, or even 3-blade razors. That being said, I would say it is a decently deep shave if you go over the same area a few times. Just take a couple fingers and run them across areas you've gone over to check, against the grain, if the hair is still there. After one day(at least for my hair growth), you get the hint of scratchiness, and I usually like to shave with it every other day.Discomfort: I would say the discomfort of shaving with this is just shaving. I've been using electrics for 90% of shaves after puberty, so I am fairly inexperienced. Thusly, this is the perfect razor for me. I had always thought that normal """safety""" razors would actually be a good razor if it was like a Norelco, which has it's blades behind about 0.5 mm steel with slits for the hairs. This is the best I've seen for something like that in safety razors. The discomfort I have is at its height when I haven't shaved a couple days.Anything else I missed is probably in the other reviews. You CAN cut yourself with this razor, but it reduces the chance of it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing seriously just wow
reviews.reviewText: I been shaving my head for 10 years and always use 5 blades due to my thick hair and I shave daily since my hair grows so fast also but wow I did not expect 2 blade razor would cut this smooth it is truly amazing.You just gain a new lifetime customer never stop making these.

reviews.reviewText: The blades that came with it are very good! Gillette still makes good razors and blades!! SF

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good razor for sensitive skin.
reviews.reviewText: I like the design and how smooth it slides across the skin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: why do i never hear anyone else have the issue i always have, which is: unless you store your razor standing upright - your razor is easily ruined. even just setting it down for the day, if the razor side is resting on any surface whatsoever the strip of whatever they even put on razors now gets stuck and peels off, and im assuming, rendering the razor useless. seems like an important detail: dont have 20$ razors be so precious they’re ruined if they are literally set down in any position but up. i remember being able to rest a razor anywhere lol. its strange peeling off some plastic rubbery substance from porcelain sink with a putty knife bc i shaved and sat my razor down afterwards. OTHERWISE its a great

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Worth the money ladies for our little area.
